intro: Linosyris racemosa, commonly known as the clustered linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bract structures. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are often clustered together. Linosyris racemosa is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils and is drought-tolerant. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
